He warned that the security environment is becoming'more dynamic, more diverse and more degraded'. Social cohesion is eroding, trust in institutions is declining, intolerance is growing and truth itself is being undermined by conspiracy, mis- and disinformation. Three of ASIO's main security concerns, espionage, foreign interference and politically-motivated violence are 'flashing red' right now, and all other key areas of concern are likely to join over the next five years. The terrorism threat is not likely to be lowered by 2030, while the rise of neo-Nazis is likely to continue.

articles.title: Flamingo numbers plummet as wetlands deteriorate
articles.author: Cyprus Mail
articles.summary: The decline of flamingos in Cyprus' wetlands has raised concerns among conservationists. The main reason is the degradation of their wetland habitats due to human activity and environmental changes. Experts warn that if current trends continue, one of Cyprus' most spectacular natural events, the annual arrival of the flamingos, could soon be threatened.

articles.title: Experts reveal why US has been so cold this winter, as snow spreads as far ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: January was the coldest on record in the US since 1988. An intense polar vortex has been running through the lower 48 since January 1st. It's because of the polar vortex that has plunged Americans into freezing temperatures. It was the first time since 1988 that January was so cold.

articles.title: In Response: Column's climate claims can't stand up to scrutiny
articles.author: Duluth News Tribune
articles.summary: The Feb. 12 "National View" column, "Science doesn't support the heated rhetoric over climate change," questioned the severity of climate change and presented an important minority perspective. The writer was Roy W. Spencer, an author and a principal research scientist at the University of Washington.

articles.title: Droughts, floods and economic uncertainty: Portraits of the Wayuu people in northern Colombia
articles.author: San Francisco Chronicle
articles.summary: Climate change is changing the way of life of the Indigenous Wayuu people living in the arid La Guajira region of northern Colombia and Venezuela. Prolonged droughts have worsened water scarcity, straining the area's resources. It is affecting the Wayuu's semi-nomadic lifestyle.

articles.title: State Human Development Report to examine impact of climate change in Himachal
articles.author: Shimla
articles.summary: Himachal Chief Secretary Prabodh Saxena presided over the orientation workshop for preparing the State Human Development Report. The report will examine the impact of climate change and variability on human development in the State. It will propose strategies for climate smart development and construction and identify opportunities to accelerate progress.

articles.title: Dave McWethy: As wildfires increase across the West, preparedness is essential
articles.author: Dave McWethy Guest columnist
articles.summary: There was a record-breaking fire season in 2017 in Montana and the West. The Lodgepole Complex burned 271,000 acres and destroyed over 1.3 million acres. The 2017 fire season was the first time Montana's wildfire-related costs surpassed $1 billion. A warming climate will continue to lead to larger, more frequent, and costlier wildfires across the West, especially in the Western states.

articles.title: Australia says China has not explained naval live-fire warning
articles.author: AFP
articles.summary: Australia and New Zealand have been monitoring three Chinese navy vessels since they were spotted in international waters off the country's coast last week. They broadcast a live-fire warning that forced commercial flights to change course. Australia has not received a satisfactory explanation from Beijing.

articles.title: New Zealand's glaciers have shrunk by 29% since 2000 – when will you admit global warming is here?
articles.author: Martyn Bradbury
articles.summary: New Zealand's glaciers have shrunk by 29% since 2000, while glaciers in Central Europe diminished by as much 39%, and in the Middle East by 35%. Last month was the warmest January on record, with surface – air temperatures 1.75C above preindustrial levels.

articles.title: Enter sustainable DEVILopment
articles.author: Joe B
articles.summary: Nik Kowsar is an award-winning Iranian-American journalist, cartoonist, and water issues analyst based in Washington, D.C. He was exiled to Canada and the U.S. after his arrest for a cartoon satirizing a powerful cleric. He believes the UN's Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) were heroically crafted to create 'peace and prosperity for people and the planet' but governments have turned them into something useless than a paper straw in a hurricane.

articles.title: Climate change: KCCI seeks urgent action to safeguard Kashmir's economy
articles.author: Kr Desk
articles.summary: Kashmir Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI) has raised urgent concerns over the severe ramifications of climate change and erratic weather patterns on the region's economy. The effects of reduced rainfall and snowfall, alongside rapidly melting glaciers pose serious risks to livelihoods across the region. A staggering 80% reduction in hydroelectric power generation has been reported. A lack of adequate snowfall has led to the postponement of the prestigious Khelo India Winter Games in Gulmarg.
